comments:
Using RC2.

In brand new workspace set auto-build off and import jdt-core projects and all
its prerequesites with source folders.

Now, close all projects => plenty of ResourceException occur in console:
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource
/org.eclipse.update.configurator is not open.
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.checkAccessible(Project.java:124)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.createMarker(Resource.java:627)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaProject.createClasspathProblemMarker(JavaProject.java:706)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaProject.getResolvedClasspath(JavaProject.java:1861)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessingState$ProjectUpdateInfo.updateProjectReferencesIfNecessary(DeltaProcessingState.java:98)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.resourceChanged(DeltaProcessor.java:1905)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessingState.resourceChanged(DeltaProcessingState.java:414)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:283)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:615)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:758)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:277)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:151)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.broadcastChanges(AutoBuildJob.java:76)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:207)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
...
Looks like closing projects doesn't wait for build to be finished.

Actually, problem is in our land. We do post classpath updates, and never 
checks that project got closed or deleted before performing these at later 
stage.

Exception dumps only occur in tracing mode however. 

Checked that the exception has no severe consequences in this scenario, as it 
occurs right before any update is performed, and exception is swallowed by 
#createClasspathProblemMarker(...).

Should consider to address post 3.0, but not critical for RC3.
